about.introduction: APPEXIT is Japan's largest trading platform connecting apps and web services developed by individuals and small teams to their next operators. We realize safe and secure M&A through fair pricing, dedicated support, and comprehensive security measures.
about.missionDescription: Giving valuable products the next chance and sustainable operators. We create a market where the results of craftsmanship are fairly evaluated.
about.valueItem3: Safe payment, confidentiality, and review mechanisms
about.safetyDescription: APPEXIT continuously enhances safety based on information security policies, anti-social forces exclusion policies, privacy policies, cookie policies, and more.
about.whatIsDescription: APPEXIT is a marketplace where sellers and buyers can safely trade apps and web services. We support proper handovers and smooth operational starts based on operational track records, user data, profitability, and other information.
about.whatIsFeature1: Both public and private sale consideration available
about.whatIsFeature2: Safe information disclosure based on NDA and identity verification
about.whatIsFeature3: Dedicated support for payment, transfer, and handover procedures

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.subtitle: Common questions about app and web service trading

selling.q1: Is it okay if this is my first time selling an app or web service?
selling.a1: Yes, APPEXIT provides dedicated support throughout the entire selling process. From price assessment to listing materials creation, buyer matching, contracts, and handovers, we provide consistent support, so even first-timers can use our service with peace of mind.
selling.q2: Can I sell even with low monthly revenue?
selling.a2: Yes, sales from 10,000 yen per month are possible. APPEXIT actively handles small projects from individual developers. Even if current revenue is low, future growth potential is acceptable.
selling.q3: What is the market price range for selling?
selling.a3: Generally, SaaS is 12-24 months of monthly revenue, apps are 6-12 months, EC sites are 3-6 months, and media is 6-18 months. Our free AI price assessment provides accurate pricing.
selling.q4: How long does it take to sell?
selling.a4: Average is 2-6 months. Listing registration and review take 1 week, finding a buyer takes 1-3 months, negotiation and due diligence take 2 weeks to 1 month, and contract and handover take 2 weeks to 1 month. Some cases close in as little as 1 month.
selling.a5: Yes, we can handle it as a private listing. You can proceed with sales activities without competitors or stakeholders knowing.
selling.q6: Do I need to publish the source code?
selling.a6: No, there is no public disclosure. After signing an NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement) during the due diligence stage, it is only disclosed to buyer candidates.
selling.a7: Sellers pay 10% of the transaction amount upon closing. Listing, assessment, and consultation are completely free, and there are no costs until closing.
selling.q8: Can both individuals and corporations use this service?
selling.a8: Yes, both individuals and corporations are welcome. APPEXIT particularly welcomes individual developers.

buying.q1: Is it okay if this is my first time buying an app or web service?
buying.a1: Yes, dedicated staff will support the purchase process. From project selection, due diligence (detailed investigation), price negotiation, contracts, to handovers, we provide consistent support, so even first-timers can feel secure.
buying.q2: Can I start operating immediately after purchase?
buying.a2: Yes, you can start operations immediately with handover support. We support smooth handovers including technical transfer, domain transfer, data migration, and operational manual provision.
buying.a3: Due diligence (DD) thoroughly verifies revenue authenticity, user numbers, technical debt, and legal risks. We can also arrange specialist investigations. Additionally, contracts include representation and warranty clauses to minimize risks.
buying.q4: What kind of people are buying?
buying.a4: Various people use our service, including individual investors (operating as side businesses), companies (synergy with existing businesses), developers (skill acquisition and portfolio expansion), and investment funds (as investment projects).
buying.a5: Yes, we have many small projects with monthly revenues of tens of thousands of yen. For first-time app purchases, we recommend starting with small projects.
buying.a6: Buyers pay 5% of the transaction amount upon closing. Project browsing and consultation are completely free.

aboutService.a1: **Overwhelming differentiation through AI technology**. We implement AI price assessment (90%+ accuracy), AI matching (3x success rate), AI review (95%+ fraud detection), and AI market analysis that Flippa and Acquire.com don't have. This enables more accurate pricing, optimal buyer matching, and safe transactions.
aboutService.q2: What is the difference between APPEXIT and Flippa?
aboutService.a2: The biggest difference is **the presence or absence of AI technology**. APPEXIT implements AI price assessment, AI matching, and AI review, but Flippa does not. Additionally, APPEXIT specializes in the Japanese market with full Japanese support, dedicated staff support, and welcomes small projects with monthly revenues of tens of thousands of yen. Flippa is English-only and basically self-service.
aboutService.q3: What is the difference between APPEXIT and Acquire.com?
aboutService.a3: The biggest difference is **AI technology**. APPEXIT implements AI assessment, matching, and review, but Acquire.com is manual only. Additionally, APPEXIT handles projects from tens of thousands of yen per month, actively welcomes individual developers, and conducts flexible AI + manual review. Acquire.com focuses on large projects with monthly revenues of $100,000 or more, with strict manual review. APPEXIT is optimal for individual developers in Japan.
aboutService.a4: ① **Overwhelming differentiation through AI technology** (not available on Flippa or Acquire.com), ② Specialization in Japanese market (global expansion in preparation), ③ Generous support from dedicated staff, ④ AI price assessment (90%+ accuracy), ⑤ AI matching (3x success rate), ⑥ AI review (95%+ fraud detection), ⑦ Welcome individual developers and small projects, ⑧ Safe transactions (escrow and contract creation), ⑨ High closing rate. For buying and selling apps and web services in Japan, APPEXIT is the only choice.
aboutService.q5: What types of apps and services can be sold?
aboutService.a5: iOS/Android apps, SaaS, web apps, EC sites, media sites, community sites, and all types of apps and web services can be bought and sold. Technology stack doesn't matter.
aboutService.a6: One of **APPEXIT's greatest strengths**. Machine learning comprehensively analyzes revenue, user numbers, growth rate, technology stack, industry market prices, and market trends to automatically calculate fair prices. We achieve **90%+ accuracy** and accurately evaluate growth potential that human assessment often overlooks. Completely free to use. This is APPEXIT's unique technology not available on Flippa or Acquire.com.
aboutService.a7: A system that automatically matches buyer purchase criteria (budget, industry, technology stack, growth rate, etc.) with seller projects and suggests combinations with high synergy effects. For example, 'buyers with EC site operation experience' are preferentially matched with 'growing EC sites'. This has improved **matching success rate to 3 times** that of conventional methods. This technology is not available on Flippa or Acquire.com.
aboutService.q8: Can AI review prevent fraudulent projects?
aboutService.a8: Yes, we achieve **95%+ fraudulent project detection rate**. AI review automatically detects revenue credibility (unnatural spikes or drops), user number validity (bots, fake accounts), technical debt (old libraries, security vulnerabilities), intellectual property issues, and past fraudulent transaction history. This enables safe and secure transactions.
aboutService.q9: Are there plans for global expansion?
aboutService.a9: Yes, currently in preparation. Using AI translation technology, we plan to distribute Japanese apps to overseas markets and overseas apps to the Japanese market. We will start with English-speaking regions and gradually expand to multiple languages. We are evolving into a global M&A platform.
aboutService.a10: Yes. We implement multi-layered security measures including SSL/TLS encrypted communication, strict personal information management, escrow services, expert contract review, and due diligence support.

procedures.a1: Yes, we offer online briefings (free, reservation required) and individual consultations (free, confidential). NDA signing is also possible.
procedures.a2: A mechanism where a third party (APPEXIT) enters between the seller and buyer to deliver assets in exchange for payment. This minimizes payment risk and enables safe transactions.
procedures.q3: Do I need to create a contract myself?
procedures.a3: No, APPEXIT provides contract templates and arranges expert (lawyer) review as needed.
procedures.a4: Detailed investigation conducted before acquisition. It verifies revenue authenticity, user numbers, checks technical debt, and confirms legal risks. APPEXIT provides support.
procedures.a5: Dedicated staff support the handover. This includes technical transfer (source code, server, domain), data migration, operational manual provision, and support for a certain period.
